page.title: 17 CLIFTON - DESCRIPTION
page.content: Clifton is a small village on the western part of this area. It is situated on a small bank or cliff above the River Cherwell and it is in Oxfordshire. The {AGRICULTURE} is mainly cereals but there are grass meadows down by the river. Hazelhedge Farm, to the north, is now only 2 barns. At the eastern end of the village, there is an old {WATERMILL} on the River Cherwell. It still has the remains of the undershot waterwheel. A herd of goats is kept here and they sell goat's milk and cheese. There is an old disused Methodist CHAPEL and an old CHURCH now used as a jewellery factory. There is a large POULTRY FARM. There are no shops; the nearest Post Office is at Deddington
